title: Bids in for Navis Capital's Modern Star, shortlisting imminent
text:
The midnight oil is burning at Luminis Partners and Morgan Stanley as the pair's local bankers trawl through first-round offers for Navis Capital's $750 million-plus educational resources business Modern Star.

It is understood more than a dozen indicative bids were sent to the auctioneers late last week, and bidders have been told to expect news of shortlisting by the end of this week.

Modern Star supplies educational resources to schools and child care centres. Phil Carrick

While the names on the shortlist are yet to be determined, the auction is expected to see a couple of offshore trade types up against the usual regional and bigger local buyout funds who are cashed up and looking to deploy dry powder.

Bidders were told to be ready to head straight into the auction's second round, with binding offers to be due before the end of the year. The tight timetable spells a busy run into Christmas for all involved.

Modern Star is a childcare and schools supplier that was pitched as the No.1 partner in Australia and New Zealand for education resources. It expects more than $60 million in EBITDA in the 2020 financial year and more than 20 per cent of group sales to come from its China business.

The sale comes as M &A interest in the education sector has been high off the back of BGH Capital’s recent bid for Navitas at 15 times EBITDA, Ardian’s acquisition of Study Group and UK-based Inspired’s bid for Pacific Equity Partners’ Academic Colleges Group late last year.

Navis Capital has owned the company since 2014.
description: The midnight oil is burning at Luminis Partners and Morgan Stanley as their local bankers examine offers for Modern Star.
